messages.message: As I’m going through setting up a local dev environment, I noticed that the docs state we’re on `go 1.11`, with a note that `1.12` is explicitly not supported. Is that still true, and if so, is there any interest in a pull request to support `1.12` (whatever that entails - I haven’t even started looking)? Or is this something that is in the works/has been looked at already/is none of my business go away? I ask as that seems like a decent way to learn the ins-and-outs of building the codebase, the PR process for non-trivial things, testing, the CI/CD pipeline, etc.

If I recall from the last time I read the release notes, this isn’t hard, but they made a bunch of possibly-non-backwards compatible changes either in 1.11.5 or 1.11.6 and they carried those changes into 1.12. So we would have to update all our go.sum files and also force everyone to upgrade their local install.
